snippet: Understanding the dispute in Oregon requires a look at American history, and how geography, climate and politics shaped “the frontier.”

byline.original: By QUOCTRUNG BUI and MARGOT SANGER-KATZ

lead_paragraph: Understanding the dispute in Oregon requires a look at American history, and how geography, climate and politics shaped “the frontier.”
abstract: The Upshot; Q&A examines how United States government came to own 47 percent of all land in American West.

headline.main: Why the Government Owns So Much Land in the West
headline.print_headline: Why the Government Owns So Much Land in the West
